title: There's no reason Darius doesn't have an execution indicator
body:
- Cho'Gath has a true damage ultimate 
 - Cho'Gath gets a visual indicator to determine when his target will die


- Darius has a true damage ultimate
 - Darius does _not_ get a visual indicator to determine when his target will die

Seems like a pretty simple addition to help Darius players stay relevant throughout the course of a full length game.

{{champion:60}}  does damage based on % missing enemy health on Q. it is stated it's pretty much her execute. no indicator on when it will kill.
{{champion:222}}  Does a large base damage and % missing enemy health. Is OBVIOUSLY her execute. no indicator.

{{champion:31}}  ONLY has an indicator on his feast because it's related to his feast stacks and growth. THATS IT. his execute isn't just tied to killing an enemy, it's also tied to his HP growth and ability to tank for his team. His execute also applies to jungle mobs for the very reason of allowing him to gain these stacks and it only gained the indicator so that players playing Cho could acquire these stacks without the guesing game.

Every other champion with an execute has literally no other motive behind using it other than to kill a single enemy. Cho gath needs to in order to be fully utilized and relevant. Otherwise he's a squishy pint size void-ling instead of a towering tanky void-king.

The difference between all of those and Cho's and Darius's is that they are either not ultimates (Elise), are actually modified by % missing health (Garen, Jinx, Elise), can be avoided by some means (Jinx, Cait) or don't deal true damage.

So if we were to compare any of these abilities, Cho's is by far the most similar to Darius.  They both also have a big reason to make sure that their ult kills someone beyond the standard "their dead":  Cho gets stacks, Darius gets resets.  If Cho messes up his ult he doesn't get health and is nearly useless.  If Darius messes up his ult he doesn't get a reset and loses all of his kill pressure if it is middle to late game, making him nearly useless.

The only reason I consider to be reasonable for Darius not getting the indicator is that his ult has some variability to the damage thanks to blood stacks and it might cause visual clutter with the blood stacks as well, and even then I think an indicator would not be a bad addition.

That kind of sounds Sheepish. First off, Dr. Mundo is a sustained damage tank. He is never scary unless you're hit by a Cleaver and have no way to escape. Mundo gains 100 AD, potentially gaining another 99 based on his health. It has no scaling, he has no AA reset, and he has one of the lowest attack speeds in the game. He will only get 2 attacks off in 5 seconds. Mundo's only option is to build tank because he doesn't do well building anything else.

1 Total AD + 199 (at 1% health)

Yorick gets an AA reset which can be done in less than 1 sec. 
1 Total AD + 1.2 Total AD + 150 + [40  + 35% Total AD (per hit by ghoul)]

Mundo gets a 35% speed boost when he ults. Yorick gets a 35% speed boost by pressing Q. The duration is 5 seconds, his cooldown is 5 sec with no CDR. Meaning he can ALWAYS have his speed boost up and AA reset often versus Mundo's 7 second CD.

Mundo's Slow is 40% and last 2 seconds, dealing 280 dmg to a single person, but does scale if versus tanks.
Yorick has a 40% AoE slow, lasts 1.5 secs, and whenever his ghoul (40 + 35% AD dmg per hit) attacks, it also slows for 5 seconds. It also gives sight.

Yes Mundo is a better tank, that's what he does. But his damage is not scary. The only scary thing about Mundo is that if he lands a slow on you, you might be stuck fighting him. He has CC mitigation but no damage mitigation, so he still suffers horribly to ADC.

Yorick gets 20% damage reduction, technically has 4 damage abilities, and heals 40% of all damage his E ever does whether it be immediately or sustained. Yorick can fight an ADC with his burst (since honestly they will always win a long duration trade).

**In 1 Second, spam blasting his ghouls. He can deal, after 1 autoattack:**

121 (auto) + 121 + 150 (120% AD) + 200 (100% AP) + 175 (100% Bonus AD) = 767 + 145 = 912 + AP + Bonus AD
1 Attack from every ghoul = 180% AD + 40 = 258
===> In 1 second, Yorick deals **1170 **base damage.

Mundo deals **689 **damage in 1 sec at 1% health. He does 59% as much damage, and his sustained damage is mainly his W with an AP scaling, while Yorick's is 105% Total AD + 40 per second. Yorick is very scary. Not to mention his itemization strongly benefits his damage and sustain while Mundo's itemization only really benefits his sustain.

Even with Sunfire, Mundo will only deal 135 dmg per second. The item costs 2600 gold. For that much, Yorick can buy a Muramana and a longsword, have +35 AD + AD (2% of max mana) and +3% of max mana in dmg. Mundo's  biggest issue is that once he gets to the backline, he's not a huge threat. He just walks around throwing cleavers trying to whittle people down. It's very hard for him to actually kill someone during a teamfight unassisted. Also when you have a Yorick in lane, all of those champs you listed will be starved, minus maybe Irelia, so that he's always at an advantage anyway. He can 1v1 all of them (except mega gnar). He doesn't get outclassed at tanky harassment top by anyone, except by AP champions like Vlad.

Also Mundo can't build anything BUT tank items. If your team is lacking in damage, you can't do anything to help. He's very limited which is why he also isn't popular anymore.
